Class DatabaseDumper

java.lang.Object
DatabaseDumper
Direct Known Subclasses:
DatabaseDumper201
public abstract class DatabaseDumper
extends java.lang.Object
Interface for 201 Coursework which defines the methods that need to be implemented in order for the work to be marked and tested againast different databases.

    • getDatabaseType

      protected java.lang.String getDatabaseType()
      Returns:
      the type of database e.g. sqlite, derby etc. If the user did not specify the type, the canonical name of the connection will be used.

    • getDDLForTable

      public abstract java.lang.String getDDLForTable​(java.lang.String tableName)
      Parameters:
      tableName - to generate the create statement for
      Returns:
      the create statement needed to create the table Preferably, each line should have a different purpose e.g. a seperate line for each attribute
      c) A single text file as in (b) above, but also contains at the start the CREATE TABLE statements that create the tables that your text file will document. (But without the primary and foreign keys being indicated).
      CREATE TABLE give_course ( s_id VARCHAR(4), c_id VARCHAR(3)
      );
      d) A single text file as in (c) above, but the CREATE TABLE statements include indicators of primary keys.

      CREATE TABLE give_course ( s_id VARCHAR(4), c_id VARCHAR(3), PRIMARY KEY (s_id, c_id )
      );

      e) A single text file as in (d) above, but including foreign keys.

      CREATE TABLE give_course ( s_id VARCHAR(4), c_id VARCHAR(3), PRIMARY KEY(s_id, c_id ),
      FOREIGN KEY (s_id) REFERENCES staff(s_id),
      FOREIGN KEY (c_id) REFERENCES courses(c_id) );

    • getDatabaseIndexes

      public abstract java.lang.String getDatabaseIndexes()
      A method to get the set of index creation instructions...
      e.g.
      CREATE INDEX planets_id ON planets (planet_id); ...
      Returns:
      a String of CREATE INDEX statements.

    • getInsertsForTable

      public abstract java.lang.String getInsertsForTable​(java.lang.String tableName)
      Parameters:
      tableName - to generate the inserts for
      Returns:
      a String which will be one or more lines of INSERT INTO ..

    • getDDLForView

      public abstract java.lang.String getDDLForView​(java.lang.String viewName)
      Parameters:
      viewName - the name of the view to generate the DDL for
      Returns:
      the DDL (CREATE VIEW ...) for a named view

    • getDumpString

      public abstract java.lang.String getDumpString()
      Returns:
      A String which could either be displayed or saved to a file. It will contain important DROP statements and CREATE IF NOT EXISTS.... (g) As with (e) but with code to ensure the CREATE TABLE statements are in the â€˜correctâ€™ order. NB each CREATE, DROP INSERT etc MUST be seperated by a -- -- -- line e.g.
      -- -- --
      CREATE TABLE A();
      -- -- --
      CREATE TABLE B();

    • dumpToFileName

      public abstract void dumpToFileName​(java.lang.String fileName)
      Parameters:
      fileName - dump the dumpString to the named file

    • dumpToSystemOut

      public abstract void dumpToSystemOut()
      This method should print out the create table and insert statements in the correct order. The method will be used to create any dump file from the command prompt
